arxiv.title: LServe: Efficient Long-sequence LLM Serving with Unified Sparse Attention
arxiv.authors: Shang Yang, Junxian Guo, Haotian Tang, Qinghao Hu, Guangxuan Xiao, Jiaming Tang, Yujun Lin, Zhijian Liu, Yao Lu, Song Han
arxiv.abstract:
Large language models (LLMs) have shown remarkable potential in processing
long sequences, yet efficiently serving these long-context models remains
challenging due to the quadratic computational complexity of attention in the
prefilling stage and the large memory footprint of the KV cache in the de...

arxiv.title: Interpretable Text Embeddings and Text Similarity Explanation: A Primer
arxiv.authors: Juri Opitz, Lucas Möller, Andrianos Michail, Simon Clematide
arxiv.abstract:
Text embeddings and text embedding models are a backbone of many AI and NLP
systems, particularly those involving search. However, interpretability
challenges persist, especially in explaining obtained similarity scores, which
is crucial for applications requiring transparency. In this paper, we giv...

arxiv.title: Aligning LLMs to Ask Good Questions A Case Study in Clinical Reasoning
arxiv.authors: Shuyue Stella Li, Jimin Mun, Faeze Brahman, Jonathan S. Ilgen, Yulia Tsvetkov, Maarten Sap
arxiv.abstract:
Large language models (LLMs) often fail to ask effective questions under
uncertainty, making them unreliable in domains where proactive
information-gathering is essential for decisionmaking. We present ALFA, a
framework that improves LLM question-asking by (i) decomposing the notion of a
"good" ques...

arxiv.title: FR-Spec: Accelerating Large-Vocabulary Language Models via Frequency-Ranked Speculative Sampling
arxiv.authors: Weilin Zhao, Tengyu Pan, Xu Han, Yudi Zhang, Ao Sun, Yuxiang Huang, Kaihuo Zhang, Weilun Zhao, Yuxuan Li, Jianyong Wang, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun
arxiv.abstract:
Speculative sampling has emerged as an important technique for accelerating
the auto-regressive generation process of large language models (LLMs) by
utilizing a draft-then-verify mechanism to produce multiple tokens per forward
pass. While state-of-the-art speculative sampling methods use only a si...

arxiv.title: Prompt-to-Leaderboard
arxiv.authors: Evan Frick, Connor Chen, Joseph Tennyson, Tianle Li, Wei-Lin Chiang, Anastasios N. Angelopoulos, Ion Stoica
arxiv.abstract:
Large language model (LLM) evaluations typically rely on aggregated metrics
like accuracy or human preference, averaging across users and prompts. This
averaging obscures user- and prompt-specific variations in model performance.
To address this, we propose Prompt-to-Leaderboard (P2L), a method that...

arxiv.title: CLIPPER: Compression enables long-context synthetic data generation
arxiv.authors: Chau Minh Pham, Yapei Chang, Mohit Iyyer
arxiv.abstract:
LLM developers are increasingly reliant on synthetic data, but generating
high-quality data for complex long-context reasoning tasks remains challenging.
We introduce CLIPPER, a compression-based approach for generating synthetic
data tailored to narrative claim verification - a task that requires r...

arxiv.title: GATE: Graph-based Adaptive Tool Evolution Across Diverse Tasks
arxiv.authors: Jianwen Luo, Yiming Huang, Jinxiang Meng, Fangyu Lei, Shizhu He, Xiao Liu, Shanshan Jiang, Bin Dong, Jun Zhao, Kang Liu
arxiv.abstract:
Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown great promise in tool-making, yet
existing frameworks often struggle to efficiently construct reliable toolsets
and are limited to single-task settings. To address these challenges, we
propose GATE (Graph-based Adaptive Tool Evolution), an adaptive framework t...

arxiv.title: Scaling Text-Rich Image Understanding via Code-Guided Synthetic Multimodal Data Generation
arxiv.authors: Yue Yang, Ajay Patel, Matt Deitke, Tanmay Gupta, Luca Weihs, Andrew Head, Mark Yatskar, Chris Callison-Burch, Ranjay Krishna, Aniruddha Kembhavi, Christopher Clark
arxiv.abstract:
Reasoning about images with rich text, such as charts and documents, is a
critical application of vision-language models (VLMs). However, VLMs often
struggle in these domains due to the scarcity of diverse text-rich
vision-language data. To address this challenge, we present CoSyn, a framework
that ...

arxiv.title: Revealing and Mitigating Over-Attention in Knowledge Editing
arxiv.authors: Pinzheng Wang, Zecheng Tang, Keyan Zhou, Juntao Li, Qiaoming Zhu, Min Zhang
arxiv.abstract:
Large Language Models have demonstrated superior performance across a wide
range of tasks, but they still exhibit undesirable errors due to incorrect
knowledge learned from the training data. To avoid this, knowledge editing
methods emerged to precisely edit the specific model knowledge via efficien...

arxiv.title: Towards Economical Inference: Enabling DeepSeek's Multi-Head Latent Attention in Any Transformer-based LLMs
arxiv.authors: Tao Ji, Bin Guo, Yuanbin Wu, Qipeng Guo, Lixing Shen, Zhan Chen, Xipeng Qiu, Qi Zhang, Tao Gui
arxiv.abstract:
Multi-head Latent Attention (MLA) is an innovative architecture proposed by
DeepSeek, designed to ensure efficient and economical inference by
significantly compressing the Key-Value (KV) cache into a latent vector.
Compared to MLA, standard LLMs employing Multi-Head Attention (MHA) and its
variants...

papers_with_code.abstract: This paper presents the design, collection and verification of a bilingual text-to-speech synthesis corpus for Welsh and English. However, simple syntactic tasks such as part-of-speech (POS) tagging, dependency parsing or named entity recog...

papers_with_code.title: The Making of Coptic Wordnet
papers_with_code.abstract: With the increasing availability of wordnets for ancient languages, such as Ancient Greek and Latin, gaps remain in the coverage of less studied languages of antiquity. This paper reports on the construction and evaluation of a new wordnet for Coptic, the language of Late Roman, Byzantine and Early ...

papers_with_code.title: Jointly Learning Guidance Induction and Faithful Summary Generation via Conditional Variational Autoencoders
papers_with_code.abstract: Abstractive summarization can generate high quality results with the development of the neural network. papers_with_code.title: Automatic Text Simplification for Social Good: Progress and Challenges
Normalization of Long-tail Adverse Drug Reactions in Social Media
papers_with_code.abstract: The automatic mapping of Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR) reports from user-generated content to concepts in a controlled medical vocabulary provides valuable insights for monitoring public health. While state-of-the-art deep learning-based sequence classification techniques achieve impressive performanc...

papers_with_code.title: Digital Resources for the Shughni Language
papers_with_code.abstract: This poster describes the Shughni Documentation Project consisting of the Online Shughni Dictionary, morphological analyzer, orthography converter, and Shughni corpus. The online dictionary has not only basic functions such as finding words but also facilitates more complex tasks. Representing a lex...

papers_with_code.title: An Overview of Fairness in Data – Illuminating the Bias in Data Pipeline
papers_with_code.abstract: Data in general encodes human biases by default; being aware of this is a good start, and the research around how to handle it is ongoing. The term ‘bias’ is extensively used in various contexts in NLP systems. In our research the focus is specific to biases such as gender, racism, religion, demogra...

papers_with_code.title: Knowledge Graph Representation Learning using Ordinary Differential Equations
papers_with_code.abstract: Knowledge Graph Embeddings (KGEs) have shown promising performance on link prediction tasks by mapping the entities and relations from a knowledge graph into a geometric space. The capability of KGEs in preserving graph characteristics including structural aspects and semantics, highly depends on th...

papers_with_code.title: Supervised Quantile Normalization for Low Rank Matrix Factorization
papers_with_code.abstract: Low rank matrix factorization is a fundamental building block in machine learning, used for instance to summarize gene expression profile data or word-document counts. To be robust to outliers and differences in scale across features, a matrix factorization step is usually preceded by ad-hoc feature...

papers_with_code.title: Addressing Asymmetry in Multilingual Neural Machine Translation with Fuzzy Task Clustering
papers_with_code.abstract: Multilingual neural machine translation (NMT) enables positive knowledge transfer among multiple translation tasks with a shared underlying model, but a unified multilingual model usually suffers from capacity bottleneck when tens or hundreds of languages are involved. A possible solution is to clus...

papers_with_code.title: A Transformational Biencoder with In-Domain Negative Sampling for Zero-Shot Entity Linking
papers_with_code.abstract: Recent interest in entity linking has focused in the zero-shot scenario, where at test time the entity mention to be labelled is never seen during training, or may belong to a different domain from the source domain. Current work leverage pre-trained BERT with the implicit assumption that it bridges...

papers_with_code.title: #HowYouTagTweets: Learning User Hashtagging Preferences via Personalized Topic Attention
papers_with_code.abstract: Millions of hashtags are created on social media every day to cross-refer messages concerning similar topics. To help people find the topics they want to discuss, this paper characterizes a user’s hashtagging preferences via predicting how likely they will post with a hashtag. It is hypothesized tha...

papers_with_code.title: Tweaking UD Annotations to Investigate the Placement of Determiners, Quantifiers and Numerals in the Noun Phrase
papers_with_code.abstract: We describe a methodology to extract with finer accuracy word order patterns from texts automatically annotated with Universal Dependency (UD) trained parsers. We use the methodology to quantify the word order entropy of determiners, quantifiers and numerals in ten Indo-European languages, using UD-...

papers_with_code.title: Using Social Media Posts as Knowledge Resource for Generating Life Stories
UoR-NCL at SemEval-2022 Task 6: Using ensemble loss with BERT for intended sarcasm detection
papers_with_code.abstract: Sarcasm has gained notoriety for being difficult to detect by machine learning systems due to its figurative nature. papers_with_code.title: Towards Readability-Controlled Machine Translation of COVID-19 Texts
papers_with_code.abstract: This project investigates the capabilities of Machine Translation models for generating translations at varying levels of readability, focusing on texts related to COVID-19. Whilst it is possible to automatically translate this information, the resulting text may contain specialised terminology, or ...

papers_with_code.title: It’s quality and quantity: the effect of the amount of comments on online suicidal posts
papers_with_code.abstract: Every day, individuals post suicide notes on social media asking for support, resources, and reasons to live. Some posts receive few comments while others receive many. While prior studies have analyzed whether specific responses are more or less helpful, it is not clear if the quantity of comments ...

papers_with_code.title: PGL at TextGraphs 2020 Shared Task: Explanation Regeneration using Language and Graph Learning Methods
papers_with_code.abstract: This paper describes the system designed by the Baidu PGL Team which achieved the first place in the TextGraphs 2020 Shared Task. The task focuses on generating explanations for elementary science questions. Given a question and its corresponding correct answer, we are asked to select the facts that...

papers_with_code.title: DeepBlues@LT-EDI-ACL2022: Depression level detection modelling through domain specific BERT and short text Depression classifiers
papers_with_code.abstract: We discuss a variety of approaches to build a robust Depression level detection model from longer social media posts (i.e., Reddit Depression forum posts) using a mental health text pre-trained BERT model. Further, we report our experimental results based on a strategy to select excerpts from long t...

papers_with_code.title: Towards Collaborative Neural-Symbolic Graph Semantic Parsing via Uncertainty
papers_with_code.abstract: Recent work in task-independent graph semantic parsing has shifted from grammar-based symbolic approaches to neural models, showing strong performance on different types of meaning representations. However, it is still unclear that what are the limitations of these neural parsers, and whether these ...

papers_with_code.title: Efficient Dialogue Complementary Policy Learning via Deep Q-network Policy and Episodic Memory Policy
papers_with_code.abstract: Deep reinforcement learning has shown great potential in training dialogue policies. However, its favorable performance comes at the cost of many rounds of interaction. Most of the existing dialogue policy methods rely on a single learning system, while the human brain has two specialized learning a...

papers_with_code.title: The Samsung and University of Edinburgh’s submission to IWSLT17
papers_with_code.abstract: This paper describes the joint submission of Samsung Research and Development, Warsaw, Poland and the University of Edinburgh team to the IWSLT MT task for TED talks. papers_with_code.title: Metadata Shaping: A Simple Approach for Knowledge-Enhanced Language Models
papers_with_code.abstract: Popular language models (LMs) struggle to capture knowledge about rare tail facts and entities. papers_with_code.abstract: This paper presents solution systems for task 6 at SemEval2022, iSarcasmEval: Intended Sarcasm Detection In English and Arabic. papers_with_code.title: Representing and Reconstructing PhySH: Which Embedding Competent?
papers_with_code.abstract: Recent advances in natural language processing make embedding representations dominate the computing language world. Though it is taken for granted, we actually have limited knowledge of how these embeddings perform in representing the complex hierarchy of domain scientific knowledge. In this paper,...

papers_with_code.title: A Large-Scale Japanese Dataset for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
papers_with_code.abstract: There has been significant progress in the field of sentiment analysis. papers_with_code.title: Normalization and Back-Transliteration for Code-Switched Data
papers_with_code.abstract: Code-switching is an omnipresent phenomenon in multilingual communities all around the world but remains a challenge for NLP systems due to the lack of proper data and processing techniques. Hindi-English code-switched text on social media is often transliterated to the Roman script which prevents f...

papers_with_code.title: PANDAS@TamilNLP-ACL2022: Emotion Analysis in Tamil Text using Language Agnostic Embeddings
papers_with_code.abstract: As the world around us continues to become increasingly digital, it has been acknowledged that there is a growing need for emotion analysis of social media content. The task of identifying the emotion in a given text has many practical applications ranging from screening public health to business an...

papers_with_code.title: Exploiting Relative Frequencies for Data Selection
Phrase-aware Unsupervised Constituency Parsing
papers_with_code.abstract: Recent studies have achieved inspiring success in unsupervised grammar induction using masked language modeling (MLM) as the proxy task. papers_with_code.title: Data Protection, Privacy and US Regulation
papers_with_code.abstract: This paper examines the state of data protection and privacy in the United States. There is no comprehensive federal data protection or data privacy law despite bipartisan and popular support. papers_with_code.title: The Acceptability Delta Criterion: Testing Knowledge of Language using the Gradience of Sentence Acceptability
papers_with_code.abstract: Any test that promises to assess Human Knowledge of Language (KoL) for any statistically-based Language Model (LM) must meet three requirements: (1) comprehensive coverage of linguistic phenomena; (2) replicable and statistically-vetted human judgement data; and (3) test the LM’s ability to track th...

papers_with_code.title: Constructing Distributions of Variation in Referring Expression Type from Corpora for Model Evaluation
papers_with_code.abstract: The generation of referring expressions (REs) is a non-deterministic task. However, the algorithms for the generation of REs are standardly evaluated against corpora of written texts which include only one RE per each reference. Our goal in this work is firstly to reproduce one of the few studies ta...

papers_with_code.title: Question Modifiers in Visual Question Answering
papers_with_code.abstract: Visual Question Answering (VQA) is a challenge problem that can advance AI by integrating several important sub-disciplines including natural language understanding and computer vision. Large VQA datasets that are publicly available for training and evaluation have driven the growth of VQA models th...

papers_with_code.abstract: Automatic speech recognition is a tool used to transform human speech into a written form. papers_with_code.abstract: Knowledge distillation (KD) can be used to reduce model size and training time, without significant loss in performance. papers_with_code.abstract: Detecting Sarcasm has never been easy for machines to process. twitter.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models
twitter.authors: Kaplan, J., McCandlish, S., Henighan, T., Brown, T.B., Chess, B., Child, R., Gray, S., Radford, A., Wu, J., Amodei, D.
twitter.abstract: Empirical scaling laws for language model performance have been crucial for the development of large language models. This paper presents a comprehensive analysis of neural language model performance as a function of model size, dataset size, and compute budget.

twitter.title: Constitutional AI: A Framework for Machine Learning Systems
twitter.authors: Askell, A., Brundage, M., Hadfield, G.
twitter.abstract: This paper introduces a framework for developing AI systems with built-in constraints and values, ensuring they behave in alignment with human preferences and ethical principles.

twitter.title: The Science of Training Large Language Models
twitter.authors: Sutskever, I., Amodei, D., Hernandez, D.
twitter.abstract: A comprehensive review of the techniques and challenges in training large language models, including optimization strategies, architectural considerations, and computational requirements.

twitter.title: Multimodal Learning with Vision-Language Models
twitter.authors: Johnson, M., Li, K., Zhang, P.
twitter.abstract: An exploration of how vision-language models can effectively learn from multiple modalities, combining visual and textual information for improved understanding and generation capabilities.

twitter.title: Efficient Fine-tuning Strategies for Large Language Models
twitter.authors: Wang, R., Smith, A., Chen, T.
twitter.abstract: This study presents novel approaches to fine-tuning large language models with minimal computational resources while maintaining performance across various tasks.

twitter.title: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback: A Comprehensive Survey
twitter.authors: Miller, E., Davis, R., Wilson, J.
twitter.abstract: A detailed survey of current approaches to reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF), including methodologies, challenges, and future directions.

twitter.title: Transformer Architecture Improvements for Vision Tasks
twitter.authors: Anderson, K., Brown, L., Taylor, M.
twitter.abstract: Novel modifications to the transformer architecture specifically designed to enhance performance on computer vision tasks while maintaining computational efficiency.

twitter.title: Ethical Considerations in AI Model Deployment
twitter.authors: Thompson, S., Garcia, M., Lee, H.
twitter.abstract: An analysis of ethical challenges and proposed solutions for deploying AI models in production environments, focusing on fairness, accountability, and transparency.

twitter.title: Zero-shot Learning in Multilingual Models
twitter.authors: Kim, J., Patel, R., Müller, A.
twitter.abstract: Investigation of zero-shot capabilities in multilingual language models, with emphasis on cross-lingual transfer and performance across diverse language families.

twitter.title: Attention Mechanisms for Audio Processing
twitter.authors: Roberts, C., White, S., Martinez, E.
twitter.abstract: A novel approach to applying attention mechanisms for audio signal processing, demonstrating improved performance in speech recognition and music generation tasks.
